summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for August 5, 2019, detailing staffing shortages, inmate counts, and administrative leave. It is a routine operational log from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held, dated shortly before his death.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Routine daily activities at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, including staff shortages leading to vacated correctional assignments, inmate counts, and administrative leave usage.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report documents significant staff shortages across all three watches (Morning, Day, Evening) on August 5, 2019, leading to vacated correctional assignments.
One inmate (I/M) was reported to be on Suicide Watch with an inmate companion.
The total inmate population at the beginning of the morning watch shift on August 5, 2019, was 762.
The report shows administrative leave data including 11 AWOL (Absent Without Leave) instances and 1 suspension.
This is a routine operational document from the MCC New York, the facility where Jeffrey Epstein died approximately four days after this report date.
